content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory Interface at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of the factory input interface components:
– Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
– Dedicated burner inserter placed at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) using direction RIGHT
– Connected neighbouring entities include an existing burner inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) and an assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)
These components together serve to feed copper plates into the cable production process.

### Belt Depot Structure at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of the depot for routing extraction outputs:
– Wooden chest (crafted and placed as belt depot) at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
– Adjacent transport belt segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) that connects to the depot chest
– Dedicated depot burner inserter placed at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) using direction UP with its pickup position at (3.5, y=15.5)
This structure is used as an isolated belt target to receive items from the extraction system.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Belt Connection Targeting Error
 – Repeated connection failures occurred because transport belts were attempted to be linked directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine. Always use an inserter (or appropriate input entity) as the final target for belt connections.

• Entity Placement Issues
 – When placing a wooden chest, ensure that the target position is within the allowed distance from the player (max distance ~10) to avoid placement failures.
 – Confirm that the required entity (e.g., wooden-chest) is available in the inventory before attempting placement.
 – Avoid undefined variable errors (such as referencing “target_chest” without definition) by double-checking variable names before use.
